summary: Federal Aviation Administration safety inspectors and engineers work to ensure airlines are safe and that aircraft are designed and built to meet flight safety standards. More than half of the FAA's safety inspector and engineer workforces will be eligible to retire by 2025. In addition, these workforces must keep pace with changing technology, new data-driven oversight methods, and more. But, the FAA doesn't regularly assess...
title: Aviation Safety: FAA's Office of Aviation Safety Should Take Additional Actions to Ensure Its Workforce Has Needed Skills
